result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevon S. Reid was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Abuse Hazardous Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.316(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber Privileges.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment/30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.

DNA Sample.
AODA & follow recommendations.
Absolute Sobriety.
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevon S. Reid

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 01:37 PM/Rm. 203/Defendant Trevon S. Reid in court with attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer.  Defendant Trevon S. Reid in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA and Reporter by Zoom.  Court calls 22-CF-38 and 20-CF-27.  Plea agreement.  22-CF-38/Ct. 1 to be dismissed & read in, plea to Ct. 2.  20-CF-27/State has reviewed revocation packet and has no additions or corrections.  22-CF-38/1 year jail consecutive to any other sentence, imposed & stayed, 1 year probation concurrent with any other supervision, costs, DNA sample & surcharge, AODA and follow through with treatment recommendations, maintain absolute sobriety, maintain full time employment, counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  20-CF-27/1 year jail.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea questionnnaire and waiver of rights form filed.  Court reviews with Def.  22-CF-38/Ct. 2 - no contest plea.  Court dismisses and reads in Ct. 1 for sentencing purposes.  Court advises Def. of constitutional rights and right to jury trial.  Def. waives rights and jury trial.  Court advises Def. of elements and penalties.  Def. advised of possible deportation if not US citizen.  Court finds plea entered freely and voluntarily.  Factual basis.  Court accepts plea and finds Def. guilty of Ct. 2.  Sentencing remarks by State.  Sentencing remarks by Def.'s Atty.  Def.'s Atty. requests furlough, response by State.  Def. makes statement to Court.  Court orders:  22-CF-38/impose & stay 1 year jail, huber, consecutive to any other sentence, 1 year probation, costs, DNA sample and surcharge, AODA & follow recommendations, absolute sobriety, maintain full time employment/30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for, counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  20-CF-27/1 year jail, commencing immediately, huber, furlough - allowed to be released 4-24-22/8:00 a.m. and return on 4-24-22/8:00 p.m.  Civil judgment for any outstanding obligations.  99 days credit in 20-CF-27.  22-CF-38/Credit 0.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Def. advised of postconviction rights.

01:47 PM Defendant Trevon S. Reid, via zoom in court with attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer.  Defendant Trevon S. Reid in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trevon S. Reid appeared by video means with Attorney. Atty Restemayer has copy of complaint, waives reading, reserve right heard on bond and request emergency waiver of p.h. and plea/sentencing. Atty Restemayer reports def. has had a death in the family. Court calls 20CF27. Bond continues  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

for Transcript
Advise PD to contact DCA

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 11:59 AM in Room 203. Defendant Trevon S. Reid in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trevon S. Reid appeared by video means. All appearances are by Zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. State heard on bond, recommends $2,000 cash bond with standard conditions. Def. on PO hold. Def. heard on bond. Remarks by the Court. The Court orders $2,000 cash bond with standard conditions. Bond issue may be revisited at a later date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
